noun.etymology: borrowed from Anglo-French {it}abeyaunce{/it} "absence of a claimant or owner, lapse in succession," from {it}abaer, abair{/it} "to open wide" (from {it}a-{/it}, prefix in transitive verbs—from Latin {it}ad-{/it} {et_link|ad-|ad-} — + {it}baer, baier{/it} "to have the mouth wide open, gape, pant," from Vulgar Latin {it}*batāre{/it}, perhaps of imitative origin) + {it}-ance{/it} {et_link|-ance|-ance}

definitions.definition: {bc}A lapse in succession during which there is no person in whom a title is vested
